isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Installation - Torque Procedure for Torque-to-yield Main Bearing Cap Bolts

svcproc.title: Torque Procedure for Torque-to-yield Main Bearing Cap Bolts

figure.caption: Main bearing cap bolt torque sequence

step1.para: Tighten each main bearing cap bolt to 136 N·m (100 lbf·ft) using "Main bearing cap bolt torque sequence".
Measure Crankshaft End Play . Do not proceed to the next step in this procedure until end play is within Specification .
Tighten each main bearing cap bolt to 177 N·m (130 lbf·ft) using "Main bearing cap bolt torque sequence".

figure.caption: Main bearing cap bolt torque-to-yield marking

calloutgroup.callout1: Head of main bearing cap bolt before Torque-to-yield
Head of main bearing cap bolt after Torque-to-yield
Mark on main bearing cap surface

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use new main bearing cap bolts whenever main bearing cap bolts that have been torqued to yield are removed.
To prevent engine damage, use permanent marker to identify internal engine components and their orientation. Do not use paint or temporary markers.

step1.para: Using a permanent marker, place a mark on each new main bearing cap bolt and put another mark on the socket directly in line with the mark on each new main bearing cap bolt.
Put a mark on the main bearing cap surface 90° clockwise from each main bearing cap bolt mark.
Install socket on main bearing cap bolt to be torqued and align mark on socket with the mark on the main bearing cap bolt.

Torque-to-yield each main bearing cap bolt by rotating each bolt 90 degrees clockwise (1/4 turn) in "Main bearing cap bolt torque sequence". The marks on the socket, main bearing cap bolt, and main bearing cap surface should be aligned.
